DOC.brief_title: Prostate Embolization Acute Urinary Retention Study
DOC.detailed_description: This open-label prospective , multicenter ( centralized procedure ) , single arm , sequentially enrol study . Twenty subject enrol study . Patient refer attend urologists failure currently recommend approach Trial WithOut Catheter ( TWOC ) alpha-adrenergic receptor ( AR ) blocker . It expect AUR case refer local urological clinic consider inclusion trial . A trial log book complete refer local urologist order obtain preliminary data applicability trial AUR comer institution . This log book limit simple questionnaire ensure high rate completion attend resident/fellow ( Patients age , size prostate , previous Benign Prostate Hypertrophy symptom , renal function ) . It use order assess external validity first phase trial help design potential next step trial . When patient present AUR correspond urological clinic , PI Clinical research coordinator inform short text message , fax e-mail order prepare follow process . Patient inform urologist ongoing research project . In summary , consist inform patient first step TWOC case failure TWOC several option offer include PAE trial setting . Inclusion patient consider case failure TWOC . If patient willing participate , patient see clinic Principal Investigator co-investigator order inform protocol obtain sign informed consent . PAE schedule upon first contact make sure PAE perform short delay follow failure TWOC . The goal perform PAE week follow recatheterization . For practical reason delay might extend recorded Case Report Form .
DOC.criteria: AUR Patients present first episode AUR relate BPH ( matter previously know ) AND Failure first TWOC AND Prostate size > 50 ml ( ultrasound measurement ) Volume AUR > 500 ml ultrasound BPH know obstructive complication AUR related cause ( Acute prostatitis document Prostate cancer ) Severe iodine allergy Known prostate cancer Known acute chronic prostatitis Ongoing acute pyelonephritis septicemia urinary origin Patient refuse PAE Severe renal failure ( creatinine Clearance < 20 ml/min ( MDRD ) Contraindication AR blocker ( postural hypotension micturition syncope ) Contraindication anticoagulant Patient catheterize suspubian catheter Patient < 18 > 75 year old Patients prisoners Patients mentally incapacitated Patients participate investigational study involve peripheral vasculature Patients unable unwilling provide write informed consent Patients ineligible pelvic angiography embolization include severe atheromatous condition anatomical condition
